column4: can I have sudo invoke a command as a user without prompting for a password?  I only want it for this one command.
man sudoers
ahhh ok.  I was in sudo

I simply want to be able to bind a key for   rmmod psmouse

You need to add a line to the file, identifying the user who can give the command, and which command.  An example line is "pete  HPPA = /usr/bin/passwd [A-z] *, !/usr/bin/passwd root", meaning pete can change anyone's password except root's.
